# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_diabetes`
* Variable label: `History of  Diabetes mellitus`
* Variable description: `History of diabetes or high blood sugar`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | Not Diabetes or high blood sugar
1        | Diabetes or high blood sugar

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_diabetes_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed diabetes`
* Variable description: `The age first told had diabetes or high blood sugar diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of diabetes"
ds_label_age <- "Age first diagnosed diabetes"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## Greece


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `DM` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Diabetes Mellitus at baseline`|
| **Table name**  | `ATTICA_Baseline`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes; 0 = No` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ATTICA_w1','ATTICA.ATTICA_Baseline',variables=list('DM'), missings = T)
ATTICA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'ATTICA_w1')

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_w1$DM
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ATTICA_w1, aes(x=factor(DM))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w1$id)
ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- ATTICA_w1$DM

ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(h_diabetes))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes)
BeforeH <- table(ATTICA_w1$DM, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1")
kable(C)

```



### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `DM5` |`age`|`yintw (w1)`|`yintw (w2)`|
|-|-|-|-|-|

| **Description** |  |  |  |  |


```{r local w2, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_w2$DM5
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w2)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ATTICA_w2, aes(x=factor(DM5))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ATTICA_w2$age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(ATTICA_w2)[3])

ggplot(ATTICA_w2, aes(age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(20,95)

vbl <- ATTICA_w2$yintw_w1
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w2)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ATTICA_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_w1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ATTICA_w2$yintw_w2
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w2)[5])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `DM == 0 and DM5 == 0 into 0`
* `DM == 1 or DM5 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_diabetes_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_diabetes_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_diabetes == 0, h_diabetes_age = 996`
* `h_diabetes == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w2$id)

ATTICA_w2 <- left_join(ATTICA_w2, ATTICA_w1, by = "id")
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 0) & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 0)] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 1) | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & (!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 1)] <- 1

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w2$age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0]-(ATTICA_w2$yintw_w2[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0]-ATTICA_w2$yintw_w1[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0])/2

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 0] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0] <- diabetes_age

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age, labels = cont_label)

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w2, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w2, aes(x=factor(h_diabetes))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w2, aes(h_diabetes_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(25,85)

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w2, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes, useNA = "ifany")
X <- c(
  sum(((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 0) & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 0)),
  sum(((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 1) | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & (!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 1))
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(ATTICA_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
```

```{r local w3, echo=F}
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")

kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(ATTICA_w3)[3])

ggplot(ATTICA_w3, aes(age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(20,95)

vbl <- ATTICA_w3$yintw_w3
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w3)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `DM == 0 and DM5 == 0 and DM10 == 0 into 0`
* `DM == 1 or DM5 == 1 or DM10 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_diabetes_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w3 and 0 in w2, h_diabetes_age = age-(year of interview w3-year of interview w2)/2`
* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w3 and w2, h_diabetes_age as in w2`
* `if h_diabetes == 0, h_diabetes_age = 996`
* `h_diabetes == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w3}

# We use the harmonized variable of wave 2 instead of the study-specific variables from all the previous waves
# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w3$id)

ATTICA_w3 <- left_join(ATTICA_w3, ATTICA_ds_w2, by = "id")
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$DM10 == 0) & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes)) & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes == 0)] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$DM10 == 1) | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes)) & (!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes == 1)] <- 1

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w3$age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0]-(ATTICA_w3$yintw_w3[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0]-ATTICA_w3$yintw_w2[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0])/2

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 0] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0] <- diabetes_age
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==1] <- car::recode(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==1],"miss_values_vector=999")

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age, labels = cont_label)

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes) <- ds_label
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes) <- ds_label
label(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age) <- ds_label_age
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes) <- ds_label
label(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age) <- ds_label_age


ATTICA_m_ds_w1 <- ATTICA_ds_w1
ATTICA_m_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w1$h_diabetes, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ATTICA_m_ds_w2 <- ATTICA_ds_w2
ATTICA_m_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w2$h_diabetes, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ATTICA_m_ds_w3 <- ATTICA_ds_w3
ATTICA_m_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w3$h_diabetes, "miss_values_vector=NA")


tt <-    frq(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[5] <- frq(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes), length(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes), length(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(ATTICA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","h_diabetes")], ATTICA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","h_diabetes")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ATTICA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","h_diabetes")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2", "w3")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```



# Quality estimation

We assume that if an individual answers it has diabetes in one wave, it has diabetes for all the next waves. Individuals with discrepancies with respect to this criterium are specified at the end of each validation.


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Save -->
```{r save, include=FALSE, echo=F}

l.ATTICA <- list(w1 = ATTICA_ds_w1, w2 = ATTICA_ds_w2, w3 = ATTICA_ds_w3)

for(index in seq_along(l.ATTICA)){
  h_diabetes <- l.ATTICA[[index]]
  save(h_diabetes, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.ATTICA)[index],"/h_diabetes.RData"))
}

```
